root_causes: No executable SPSS commands are present to perform the described validation (missing TEMPORARY/SELECT IF/LIST block). The script only contains descriptive text and commented examples.

The check is not actually scoped to production respondents as required by the expected logic (IsInProductionMode()). The script only provides commented examples for scoping but does not implement either a production-scoped or an all-cases check.
Because no executable check is present, respondents with missing or out-of-range values are not being flagged as required.
instructions:
Add an executable validation block that flags records where qList is missing or contains a value outside the allowed set {1,2}. If you must run the check across all cases (no production flag available), use for example:
TEMPORARY.
SELECT IF (MISS(qList) OR ~RANGE(qList,1,2)).
LIST respid qList.

If a production-flag variable exists, scope the check to production respondents. Example if ProdMode=1 indicates production:
TEMPORARY.
SELECT IF (ProdMode = 1) & (MISS(qList) OR ~RANGE(qList,1,2)).
LIST respid qList.

If your export uses a different production indicator (e.g., qTesting where production is qTesting <> 1), replace the SELECT IF condition accordingly, for example:
TEMPORARY.
SELECT IF ((qTesting <> 1 OR MISS(qTesting))) & (MISS(qList) OR ~RANGE(qList,1,2)).
LIST respid qList.

Ensure the validation only accepts codes 1 and 2 and does not allow unconfirmed special codes (97/98/99). The ~RANGE(qList,1,2) condition already enforces this; keep it in the SELECT IF or equivalent logical test.
Retry with reduced context or smaller batch size
Retry with reduced context or smaller batch size
